Posts.Content: Hi - I had reconstruction with LD flap and developed a big hematoma/seroma in my back above the scar. The Consultant had four or five attempts to drain it but when it got to the point (about three weeks after surgery) where I began to feel ill with it, I was whisked in for emergency surgery. Even after that, the second incision drained for about three weeks - I guess I just have a problem with fluid!  I don't know how you have stuck it out for so long - surgery was my solution and really helped, so don't be scared of it!
Posts.Title: I still have a large seroma 5 months after my surgery

Posts.Content: You know, I wondered about that too... I was diagnosed in March, had surgery in April, lymph nodes were clear and so no need for radiotherapy or chemotherapy, but have started on Tamoxifen.  So what is the correct way to describe myself - I have breast cancer, I have had treatment for breast cancer, I had breast cancer?  I will be off work for a while yet as I had a mastectomy and LD flap reconstruction and yet outwardly I look fine, so I think people look at me and think everything is rosy and I'm fit and well...
Posts.Title: So what am I?...

Posts.Content: Hi, Nette70 - same here.  I was barely out of hospital in May this year when my Dad was diagnosed with bowel cancer and whipped in for an op.  Both of us are fortunate enough to have had surgery do the job - no father-daughter chemo or radiotherapy sessions for us!  Fingers crossed for you and your Dad.  X
Posts.Title: Peed off!!

Posts.Content: Hi! Having seen the positive feedback on this forum about the HOPE course, I contacted the Macmillan team last week. There are no courses on in July or August but there should be in Sept and October, dates and venues to be confirmed. You need to complete an expression of interest  form - email nilearning@macmillan.org.uk. Hope to see you at one of them!  I'm in Carrickfergus, by the way.
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi, Ossy - I contacted Macmillan and there are no HOPE courses scheduled for July or August in NI but they are planning some for Sept and Oct, venues and dates to be confirmed.  They sent me a form to complete, to say I was interested - there are six week, 2 day and 1 day programmes, if I remember rightly.  Contact nilearning@macmillan.org.uk  Jo
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: I should have said that I was responding to the request for info on HOPE courses in and around Belfast - hope I haven't confused anyone!
Posts.Title: HOPE COURSE !

Posts.Content: Hi, there I've been on Tamoxifen about a year and have had several brands. Weirdly, the one that has caused me the most trouble is Teva and I will be actively trying to avoid it when I order my next prescription. With it, I have bad joint pain, particularly in my feet. Funny, isn't it?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen brands UK list? trying to find one that suits me!

Posts.Content: I'm so glad someone else has mentioned the handbrake problem - last week, I had picked up a few bits and pieces in Sainsbury's and was in the car with my daughter, waiting to pull out of the space when a car passed, and I very nearly asked her why the car beside us was moving forwards when there was no-one driving it...  It took a few seconds for me to realise that it was actually my car rolling slowly backwards.., .  And then I did the same thing again, this time on the school run,a couple of days later.  I have only been on Tamoxifen for less than three weeks and my brain is fried...  As for not being able to recall words - a major problem if you're an English teacher!!!
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....
